description: From Latin inēbriātus, past participle of inēbriō (“intoxicate”) from in- +‎ ēbrius (“drunk, intoxicated”) from Proto-Italic *ēɣʷrjos, from Proto-Indo-European *h₁ēgʷʰ-ryo-s from root *h₁egʷʰ- (“drink”); whence also ebrious and inebriate.

adjectives.description: inebriated (comparative more inebriated, superlative most inebriated)

entries.meaning: Behaving as though affected by alcohol including exhilaration, and a dumbed or stupefied manner.
simple past tense and past participle of inebriate
